availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James Harvey Morgan (Morgan County, KY, resident and soldier)

body.p: Morgan County, Kentucky, resident and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of Johnson Morgan and Nancy Morgan. Resident in Morgan County, Kentucky in 1850. Convicted of manslaughter in Morgan County, Kentucky, in November 1859. Laborer in 1860. Incarcerated in the Kentucky State Penitentiary in Franklin County in 1860. Served in the 8th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a private and corporal from January 15, 1862 to May 10, 1865. Captured at Chickamauga, Georgia on September 20, 1863. Prisoner of war in Richmond, Virginia in September 1863. Prisoner of war in Danville, Virginia in December 1863. Prisoner of war at Andersonville, Georgia. Paroled in Wilmington, North Carolina on March 1, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Morgan County, p. 142A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Frankfort, p. 285.

Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0224.
KYR-0001-020-2242.
